item.description:
Known as Nehan-e in Japan, the Buddhist holiday of Nirvana Day marks the passing of the historical Buddha who then entered perfect nirvana, (parinirvana). The death of his physical body highlights the teachings of impermanence and eternal life, in which all things transform within the dynamism of boundless life.

This gathering will retell the last days of the Buddha, his passing and then discuss the significance of his life and these teachings in the 21st century. Includes meditation, sacred chants, prayer, discussion, and incense offering to the image of the dying Buddha on the altar. Lead by Senpai Sensei.
